articles.content:
Settlement of Issue of "Comfort Women" for Imperial Japanese Army Demanded 
    Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- Representatives of south Korean religious organizations including the Buddhist Human Rights Committee and the Buddhist Peace Solidarity reportedly made public a joint statement on Jan. 12 demanding the Japanese government repent of and compensate for the crimes related to "comfort women" for the imperial Japanese army committed by the Japanese imperialists in the past.
 Accusing the Japanese government of failing to make any compensation to the survivors of the crimes related to the "comfort women" though they are leaving this world, the statement said the Koreans can hardly repress towering resentment at this.    
 The Japanese government should be held responsible for cruelly oppressing and cracking down on the Korean nation, it noted, demanding the Japanese government make a direct compensation to the victims of the sexual slavery.
